titleStmt.title: Sweeney & Taylor, et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10079

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency B MaGoffin Govenor of the Commonwealth of Ky. this Petition respectfully Showeth, that M Smithheimer was at the present Term of the Daviess Circuit Court Convicted of the offense of Suffering gaming in his house and fined the sum of $200. -- The proof Showed that no money was bet in the games that they were played for pastime and amusement only although the players would sometimes wager a treat Cigars or something of that Kind. and We are satisfied that Mr Smitheimer was ignorant that it was an offence against law, as he is a law abiding citizens and true. We therefore earnestly recommend him to executive Clemency --

Sweeney & Taylor (Bar)
J. F. Jones Foreman of Jury
Amos Medcalf
Joseph Metcalfe
C S Noel
W S Mitchesson
W H Talbott
Jas R Steelman
Jno. P. Thompson clk
James Stuart Circuit Judge
Cisero Maxwell atty for Commonwealth
Geo H Yeaman
John D. Green
Enos H McHenry Jr
Jesse Moore
J R Allen
J. J. Daviss
W B Pegram
J G McFarland
G W Ray
W. H. Clements
Jo G Harrison
John H. McHenry
J. R. Claybrook
S K Ewing Jury
Jno Evans Juror
Jno P Fuqua Juror
John Long Juror
Wm Anthony
Chars. McClarty
Jesse W. Kincheloe
A G Botts
E Comstock
T Samuel Mitchell
C R Tyler
M Lipstine
John Locke

Daviess
Cir Ct
$200 } Gaming
M. Smitheimer
Remission Issd
Feby 25. 1861

Memorial
To}
B. Magoffin
Governor of Ky
Remitted
B. M
